comments:
Fresh install of WTP-all-in-one-1.5 (Eclipse 3.2 Calisto) cannot open several WSDL files. These files are opened bu 3.1.2 and MS Visual Studio without a hitch. I have tried both my working 3.2, which was updated and fresh install without an update.

Nikola, are you somehow using File/Open File... instead of having the WSDL files in a project? The editor will open WSDL files placed in a workspace project just fine.

Bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=144811 describes a similar scenario where the editor expecting IFileEditorInput causes class cast exceptions when a different type editor input is used.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Nikola, are you somehow using File/Open File... instead of having the WSDL
> files in a project? The editor will open WSDL files placed in a workspace
> project just fine.
> 
> Bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=144811 describes a similar
> scenario where the editor expecting IFileEditorInput causes class cast
> exceptions when a different type editor input is used.

Hi Valentin.

You are correct. I was trying to open a WSDL file using File/Open, because I just wanted to take a look at it. I had underneath another project, which I did not want to "enrich" with WSDL, just to view it. The project was a plain Java project. No web in it.

I hope this helps. It is comforting to know that WSDL works in a WS project, if I should need it.

Nix.
Nikola, just to clarify, you can have WSDL files in any type of project and they should open fine. We are working to fix the external file limitation.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 144811 ***
This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP bugs which are in the resolved state without an appropriate targeted version.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.
